com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.audio

Class WavWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.audio.WavWriter

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class WavWriter
extends java.lang.Object

    Utility class for writing audio into WAV files either by providing a discrete set of samples or by streaming the audio over time.

    This class is not thread safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WavWriter(AudioConfiguration params)
      Constructor which takes in a AudioConfiguration instance containing various parameters needed for saving WAV files.

      Creates a new audio stream session where audio samples can be continuously added until the closeAudioStreamSession() method is called.

      • WavWriter

        public WavWriter(@NonNull
                 AudioConfiguration params)
        Constructor which takes in a AudioConfiguration instance containing various parameters needed for saving WAV files.
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters needed for saving WAV files. This cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the input parameters is null.

    • Method Detail

      • newAudioStreamSession

        public final void newAudioStreamSession(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String filePath)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new audio stream session where audio samples can be continuously added until the closeAudioStreamSession() method is called.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The absolute path of the directory where the audio file will be saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the output file could not be created.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the file path is null.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if this is called while a previous audio stream session is still in progress.

      • newAudioStreamSession

        public final void newAudioStreamSession(@NonNull
                                        DataWriter writer)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Starts a new audio stream session with the provided DataWriter instance. Audio samples will be written to this writer.
        Parameters:
        writer - The instance to write audio samples to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the audio stream session has already been started.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an IO error occurred while preparing the writer for writing.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the provided writer is null.

      • closeAudioStreamSession

        public final long closeAudioStreamSession()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Closes an open audio stream session and finalizes the file by writing the header information to it.
        Returns:
        The duration of the audio (in milliseconds) of the audio that was saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the audio stream session has not been started.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the file could not be finalized by writing the header to it.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if this is called before calling newAudioStreamSession(String).

      • streamSamples

        public final boolean streamSamples(@NonNull
                                   short[] samples)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the audio to the audio stream file channel.
        Parameters:
        samples - Samples to be passed to the file channel.
        Returns:
        True if the samples were successfully written to the channel.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • streamSamples

        public final boolean streamSamples(@NonNull
                                   short[] samples,
                                   int offset,
                                   int length)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the audio to the audio stream file channel from the offset index up to the length specified.
        Parameters:
        samples - Samples to be passed to the file channel.
        offset - Index to start grabbing the audio samples.
        length - The number of audio samples to grab.
        Returns:
        True if the samples were successfully written to the channel.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the audio stream session has not been started yet.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if this is called before calling newAudioStreamSession(String).
        java.io.IOException

      • saveAudioSamples

        public final long saveAudioSamples(@NonNull
                                   java.lang.String filePath,
                                   @NonNull
                                   short[] samples)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the given audio samples into the given file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - An absolute path to where the audio samples should be saved at. Directories will be created as needed.
        samples - The samples to save to a file.
        Returns:
        The duration of the audio (in milliseconds) of the audio that was saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the file path or audio buffer is empty.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the file could not be created or written to.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the file path or audio samples are null.

      • saveAudioSamples

        public final long saveAudioSamples(@NonNull
                                   java.lang.String filePath,
                                   @NonNull
                                   byte[] samples)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the given audio samples into the given file. This variant saves byte samples.
        Parameters:
        filePath - An absolute path to where the audio samples should be saved at. Directories will be created as needed.
        samples - The byte samples to save to a file.
        Returns:
        The duration of the audio (in milliseconds) of the audio that was saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the file path or audio buffer is empty.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the file could not be created or written to.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the file path or audio samples are null.

      • saveAudioSamples

        public final long saveAudioSamples(@NonNull
                                   DataWriter writer,
                                   @NonNull
                                   short[] samples)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the given audio samples by passing them into the provided DataWriter instance.
        Parameters:
        writer - The writer instance to give the audio samples to.
        samples - The short array containing the samples to write.
        Returns:
        The duration of the audio (in milliseconds) of the audio that was saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the samples could not be written with the writer.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the writer instance or audio samples are null.

      • saveAudioSamples

        public final long saveAudioSamples(@NonNull
                                   DataWriter writer,
                                   @NonNull
                                   byte[] samples)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the given audio samples by passing them into the provided DataWriter instance.
        Parameters:
        writer - The writer instance to give the audio samples to.
        samples - The byte array containing the samples to write.
        Returns:
        The duration of the audio (in milliseconds) of the audio that was saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the samples could not be written with the writer.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the writer instance or audio samples are null.
